              [" object represents an operation which "],

              [
                " a value. Promises provide a robust way to wrap the (possibly pending) result of asynchronous work, mitigating the problem of deeply nested callbacks (known as “"

              ["”)."]

            "title": [
              ["rejected", [["i"]]],
              [
                " — An error has occurred during the operation, and the promise is "
              ],
              ["rejected", [["i"]]],
              [" with a "],
              ["reason", [["i"]]],
              [
                ". This is analogous to throwing an error in a synchronous function."
              ]

          "properties": {
            "language": [["JavaScript"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "promise.then(value => {\n    // Work has completed successfully,\n    // promise has been fulfilled with \"value\"\n}).catch(reason => {\n    // Something went wrong,\n    // promise has been rejected with \"reason\"\n});"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 3
        }
      },

          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "last_edited_time": 1551338220000,
          "parent_id": "e6941046-27e7-4c5c-954f-3edf9706dea6",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["JavaScript"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "const promise = new Promise((resolve, reject) => {\n    // Perform some work (possibly asynchronous)\n    // ...\n\n    if (/* Work has successfully finished and produced \"value\" */) {\n        resolve(value);\n    } else {\n        // Something went wrong because of \"reason\"\n        // The reason is traditionally an Error object, although\n        // this is not required or enforced.\n        let reason = new Error(message);\n        reject(reason);\n\n        // Throwing an error also rejects the promise.\n        throw reason;\n    }\n});"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 3
        }
      },

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Attaching callbacks to a promise that has already been settled will immediately place them in the "
              ],
              [
                "microtask queue",
                [["a", "http://stackoverflow.com/a/25933985/5931915"]]
              ],
              [
                ", and they will be invoked “as soon as possible” (i.e. immediately after the currently executing script). It is not necessary to check the state of the promise before attaching callbacks, unlike with many other event-emitting implementations."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
